snippet: While California passed a ban on concealed weapons at schools, other states considered bills to ease restrictions on concealed firearms on campus.

byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Julie Turkewitz from Denver.
byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and JULIE TURKEWITZ

abstract: Nearly 15 states over last two years have debated legislation to make it easier for teachers, students and administrators to carry concealed firearms on college campuses; California has struck out in opposite direction, recently enacting law banning concealed weapons on campus; supporters believe armed people on campus could potentially subdue assailant before police arrive, while opponents argue increase in guns could lead to accidental injuries, suicides and culture of fear in classrooms.
lead_paragraph: While California passed a ban on concealed weapons at schools, other states considered bills to ease restrictions on concealed firearms on campus.

headline.print_headline: A California Gun Law Runs Counter to Trend
headline.main: As Campus Fears Rise, So Do Efforts to Enact School Gun Laws
